alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 4:11PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL ST. TAMMANY PARISH, NORTHERN HANCOCK AND SOUTHWESTERN PEARL RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM CST... At 411 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pearl River, or 9 miles north of Slidell, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Picayune, Pearl River, Crossroads, Mcneil, and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 5 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
